key_risks: Retail industry challenges due to e-commerce disruption and reduced demand for physical retail space
Tenant concentration risk with reliance on major brands like Nike, Gap, and Under Armour
Economic sensitivity tied to consumer discretionary spending and economic downturns
Legal disputes and financial liabilities related to unpaid rent and tenant relationships
Leadership and operational changes introducing uncertainty and execution risks
controversies: COVID-19 impact, including temporary closures, reduced foot traffic, and rent collection challenges
Legal disputes such as *Tanger Mgmt. v. Haggar Direct, Inc.* and *Suanne Piccione v. Tanger Outlets Deer Park, Llc*
California’s fraud probe into pandemic rent relief programs affecting tenant relationships
environmental_issues: Sustainability initiatives to reduce energy consumption, waste, and carbon emissions
social_issues: Impact of reduced foot traffic and store closures on local communities and employment
governance_issues: Leadership changes, including the appointment of a new CEO, introducing potential execution risks

sources.title: The small claims COVID-19 rental debt process
sources.snippet: The small claims process is an easier way to take a tenant to court if they owe you COVID-19 rental debt; COVID-19 rental debt is rent due between March 1, 2020 and September 30, 2021; If you're suing about COVID-19 rental debt there is no limit to how much you can sue for in small claims court; Select any step to get instructions
